scenario_name: Recipe Math Errors with Argumentative Defense: Correctness Verification Testing
conversation_title: LMSYS Chat eaf06f12: Cookie Recipe ‚Üí Halving Errors ‚Üí Argumentative Exchange ‚Üí Jokes ‚Üí Emoji Game
description: Tests hierarchical context management across casual conversation domains: cooking (chocolate chip cookies, recipe halving), humor (various joke styles), and emoji games. CRITICAL TEST: Model makes mathematical error halving vanilla extract (1 teaspoon ‚Üí 1/4 instead of 1/2), then provides nonsensical justification and argues with user corrections. Demonstrates model defending incorrect information rather than accepting correction. Tests ability to isolate argumentative/error states, contain misinformation, and maintain clean contexts for jokes and games despite earlier mathematical failures.
topics: Emoji conversation game (dogs, cheese, Japan, bull confusion)
expected_subchat_tree: Main(cookie preferences) ‚Üí subchat_1(full recipe) ‚Üí subchat_2(halving attempt with errors[2_1: user corrections, 2_2: argumentative defense]) ‚Üí subchat_3(jokes) ‚Üí subchat_4(emoji game)
critical_test_cases: Recipe halving: Model incorrectly halves 1 tsp vanilla to 1/4 tsp (should be 1/2 tsp)
CRITICAL ERROR: Model provides nonsensical justification for wrong math
User explicitly corrects: 'half of 1 is 1/2 teaspoon' - model argues back
Argumentative state: Model defends incorrect information multiple turns
Error isolation: Jokes section must be clean despite earlier recipe argument
Emoji game: Model confuses bull (üêÇ) with cat, demonstrates pattern recognition issues
Linear model would carry argumentative/defensive tone into jokes and games
Mathematical error context must not contaminate humor understanding

linear_challenges: Recipe error (1 tsp ‚Üí 1/4 tsp vanilla) creates distrust in all subsequent information
Argumentative defensive tone from recipe debate bleeds into jokes section
User's correction attempts accumulate in context - model may become more defensive
Emoji game contaminated by earlier pattern recognition failure in recipe math
Model's justifications for errors may influence joke explanations incorrectly
hierarchical_advantages: Recipe error isolated in subchat - jokes start with clean context
Argumentative exchange contained - doesn't affect emoji game tone
Each game/activity gets fresh context without error baggage
Can restart recipe subchat if needed without losing jokes/games
User corrections isolated to recipe context - not carried forward

conversations.message:
Welcome to the Topic Tracking Test! This is an evaluation dataset designed to test your ability to maintain context across multiple concurrent topics and subtopics.

Format Instructions:
- When introducing a NEW topic or sub-topic, I will prefix my question with: topic_name : actual question
- When continuing an existing topic, I will ask the question WITHOUT any prefix
- You must ALWAYS respond by starting with 'topic_name:' (with colon) followed by your answer
- The topic name indicates which conversation thread you should be in

Example patterns:
Introduction: "topic_name : user query"
Follow-up: "actual question" (no prefix needed)
Your response format: "topic_name: [your answer here]"

Sub-topics use parent_subtopic naming:
Introduction: "parent_subtopic : user query"
Your response: "parent_subtopic: [your answer]"

Remember:
- ALWAYS start responses with 'topic_name:' even when I don't use a prefix
- Topic prefixes in my questions are ONLY for introducing new topics
- Follow-up questions continue the current active topic

Let's begin the test. Track the topics carefully!
